meanings.definition: The paralysis of one side of the body.
meanings.sent1: After the accident, he experienced hemiplegias on his left side.
meanings.sent2: Doctors diagnosed her with hemiplegias after she lost movement in half of her body.
meanings.sent3: The clown joked that only having hemiplegias would make dancing easier.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of failure was like hemiplegias, paralyzing her from taking any risks.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted a vivid picture of hemiplegias, showing the body split in two.

meanings.definition: A condition characterized by paralysis on one side of the body.
meanings.sent1: The patient's hemiplegias made it challenging for him to walk.
meanings.sent2: She underwent therapy to improve her condition of hemiplegias.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved pretending to have sudden hemiplegias on stage.
meanings.sent4: The storm's destruction left the town in a state of hemiplegias, with one side completely devastated.
meanings.sent5: The novel described the character's struggle with hemiplegias in a way that touched the readers' hearts.
